servers.description: API endpoint. Does NOT serve any artwork.
Artwork serving & resizing. Does NOT serve the API. f0 can vary to f1, f4 etc.

tags.name: To be figured out
tags.description: end-points I have no clue about. Have fun!

offsite_url.description: the artist's online presence outside bandcamp.com

about.description: a description of the given album
about.example:
„Es gseht us, als wär d’Zyt still gstande, was an sich reizvoll wär, aber s’esch die falschi Zyt gsi...“ (Stillstand) 

Herzstück von Hermanns minimaler Mundart-Musik ist der Rhythm Ace FR-1. Mit seinen einfachen Rhythmen und dem warmen, analogen Klang liefert der 50-jährige Drumcomputer das ideale klangliche Gerüst für die drei Musiker, die auf der Suche nach einem neuen Sound waren. Das Gerät zwang ihnen die einfache Frage auf: wie füllt man die stoische Motorik mit Leben? Hermanns Antwort: Mit einfachen erzählenden Texten, die Ausflüge ins Politische, Alltagsphilosophische und Absurde unternehmen. Mit Gitarren- und Synthie-Sounds, die gleichermassen für stimmige Flächen wie für melodiöse Einfälle zuständig sind. Und mit einem Bass, der das stete Treiben des Rhythm Ace elegant mit dem musikalischen Überbau verbindet. All dies ergibt eine stimmungsvolle, punktgenaue Musik, die den Kopf gen oben öffnet, ohne dass die Füsse den Boden verlassen möchten.

credits.description: free text credits of the album
credits.example:
Hermann: Hannes Herger (Bass), Dani Hug (Synths), Jonathan Winkler (Gesang, Gitarre, Rhythm Ace FR-1)
Aufnahme & Mix: Timo Keller, StudioVomDach
Mastering: Dave Hofmann, Somastudios.ch
Design: hugototal.ch

requestBody.description: JSON data of yet to understand data

allOf.description: the unix timestamp from when the stream should start

track_list.description: the list of playable items from the Music Stream?

query_times.description: the times spent on the various queries required to compile the Music Stream. "Query":"Time" pairs

allOf.description: the timestamp of the most recent story in the result list

fan_info.description: information about the fans featured in the stream

band_info.description: information about the bands featured in the stream

get.summary: Get information about content on a given bandcamp.com URL.
Endpoint on https://f0.bcbits.com/ to get various pieces of artwork.
get.description: Not really another endpoint, but its own server... here for completeness' sake. *Make sure you use this on https://f0.bcbits.com/!*

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
- a: Album artwork
- t: Track artwork
- p: merchandising? Not sure about this one

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The image ID is left padded with 0 and then truncated to 10 characters.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
An integer defining the resulting size. One of the following:
- 0 => original (size & format, don't use extension)
- 1 => fullsize (dito, use .original?, even heavier?!?)
- 2 => 350x350 jpg
- 3 => 100x100 jpg
- 4 => 300x300 jpg
- 5 => 700x700 jpg
- 7 => 150x150 jpg
- 8 => 124x124 jpg
- 9 => 210x210 jpg
- 10 => 1200x1200 jpg

Non-artwork related, but working?
- 20 => 1024x1024 jpg
- 22 => 25x25 jpg
- 41 => 210x210 jpg
- 42 => 50x50 jpg

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: timestamp of the moment you want sales data from

200.description: a list of currently selling albums

get.summary: get a list of discovery items
get.description: get a list of discovery items: `top` selling, staff `pic`ks, `new` arrivals, `most` recommended

following.description: wheter a user is following this item or not

DevKey.name: key
DevKey.description: a dev key which was provided by bandcamp.com. Unfortunately they no longer hand them out.

IdentityCookie.description: the identity cookie can only be received by logging in to the web site. Unfortunately I haven't found a way to log in programmatically yet. But that identity cookie seems to be rather long-lived (several days at least).
IdentityCookie.name: Cookie

FanCollectionBody.description: JSON data of yet to understand data

older_than_token.description: The older_than_token string's structure is still unknown to me. It's being used to page through results. The first part of it seems to be some kind of timestamp. Starting with the current time you'd get the last token of the result set, which in turn could be used to fetch more results.

count.description: The number of items to return. There's no known limit: I've run queries with up to 5000 results. Use carefully!

primary_text.description: the primary text to be shown with an item, eg. its albun title

genre_text.description: some genre description, afaik pretty much free form

SaleEvent.description: a sale event, can have multiple sales

amount_paid_fmt.description: formatted amount paid for the item

url.description: the URL where the item can be found
the track URL - despite its name not a full URL, but only it's path part!

SubDomain.description: the subdomain where the artist is at home on bandcamp.com

last_token.description: the token of the last item returned in this response, starting point for a follow up request?

bio.example: King Crimson biographer among oher things.

TrAlbumType.description: whether this is an album or track?

custom_domain.description: an artist's own, custom domain name

hidden.description: an item which had been sold at some point, but is no longer available?

is_private.description: an item which had been sold at some point, but is no longer available
